function: Frontend application with dynamic data fetching from backend APIs
static_description: A responsive web application built with React.js that renders all content dynamically by fetching data through RESTful API calls to the backend server.

interaction_and_states.description: On page load, the frontend initializes and makes asynchronous API requests to fetch user data, course listings, and other dynamic content based on current route and session state.

resource_dependency.database_config: Connection to PostgreSQL using environment variables: DB_HOST=localhost, DB_PORT=5432, DB_USERNAME=myappuser, DB_PASSWORD=myapppassword, DB_NAME=myapp
resource_dependency.api_routes: RESTful endpoints defined under /api/v1/* for handling CRUD operations related to users, courses, enrollments, assignments, and grades

function: Backend application connecting to PostgreSQL database using specified environment variables
static_description: Express.js server configured to connect to a PostgreSQL database using predefined environment variables. It exposes RESTful API endpoints for frontend consumption and handles business logic.

resource_dependency.token_storage: Client-side localStorage for storing JWT tokens
resource_dependency.protected_routes: All course-related routes require valid JWT authentication header
resource_dependency.user_role_schema: Database table with role field indicating 'student', 'instructor', or 'admin'

static_description: Login and registration forms allowing users to authenticate. Protected routes ensure only authenticated users can access course materials, submit assignments, or view grades.

interaction_and_states.description: Upon successful validation of credentials, returns a signed JWT token stored in browser localStorage and redirects user to dashboard.
Requests to protected routes include Authorization Bearer Token header; invalid/expired tokens redirect to login page.

function: Course browsing interface displaying available Python data science courses
static_description: A grid layout showing cards representing each available Python data science course. Each card displays title, brief description, difficulty level, instructor name, and thumbnail image referenced via resource_dependency.

interaction_and_states.description: Infinite scroll pagination loads additional courses when reaching bottom of viewport by making subsequent API requests to /api/v1/courses?page=N.
Activates search bar overlay enabling keyword filtering of displayed courses based on title or description.
Filters visible course cards by selected difficulty level by appending query parameter to API request e.g., ?level=Intermediate.

resource_dependency.user_progress_schema: Database table linking user_id and course_id with completion percentage field

static_description: Each course card includes an 'Enroll Now' button. Clicking navigates to course detail page which contains full description and another 'Enroll' option if not yet enrolled.

interaction_and_states.description: POST request sent to /api/v1/enrollments endpoint creating new enrollment record. Success message shown and navigation updated to reflect enrolled status.
Displays 'Continue Learning' button instead of 'Enroll'. Redirects directly to lesson modules rather than overview.

resource_dependency.next_lesson_button: Navigates to next sequential lesson within same module

function: Learning content delivery system for enrolled courses
static_description: Sidebar navigation listing all modules and lessons. Main content area presents either video player or markdown-rendered lesson material depending on content type.

interaction_and_states.description: Fetches corresponding lesson content from backend and updates main panel display without full page reload.
Automatically marks lesson as completed after watching entire duration. Progress tracker increments accordingly.

resource_dependency.file_upload_component: Drag-and-drop file upload zone accepting .ipynb, .py files
resource_dependency.code_editor_integration: Monaco Editor embedded for inline code submissions

function: Assignment submission interface for course assignments
static_description: Dedicated assignment page presenting problem statement, due date, and two submission methods: file upload or direct code input using integrated editor.

interaction_and_states.description: Uploads chosen file to temporary storage and enables submit button upon successful validation of allowed formats (.ipynb/.py).
Submits solution to /api/v1/assignments/{id}/submit endpoint. Displays confirmation toast and adds entry to submission history list.

resource_dependency.charting_library: Chart.js for visualizing performance trends over time
resource_dependency.export_grades_button: Exports grade report as CSV file
resource_dependency.grade_breakdown_schema: Database table mapping assignment_id, user_id, score, max_score, submission_date

function: Grade querying dashboard for users to view their learning grades
static_description: Tabular representation of submitted assignments with columns: Assignment Name, Due Date, Score, Max Score, Submission Status. Additional chart visualization shows cumulative grade progression.

interaction_and_states.description: Triggers download of CSV file containing all grade records accessible to current user.
Displays tooltip with detailed breakdown of specific assignment score and relative ranking percentile if available.

resource_dependency.users_table_definition: Table with id (UUID), email (unique string), password_hash (string), created_at (timestamp), role (enum: student/instructor/admin)
resource_dependency.courses_table_definition: Table with id (UUID), title (string), description (text), difficulty_level (enum: beginner/intermediate/advanced), instructor_id (foreign key to users.id)
resource_dependency.enrollments_table_definition: Table with id (UUID), user_id (foreign key to users.id), course_id (foreign key to courses.id), enrolled_at (timestamp), progress_percentage (integer)
resource_dependency.assignments_table_definition: Table with id (UUID), course_id (foreign key to courses.id), title (string), description (text), due_date (timestamp)
resource_dependency.grades_table_definition: Table with id (UUID), assignment_id (foreign key to assignments.id), user_id (foreign key to users.id), score (float), max_score (float), submitted_at (timestamp)

function: Database schema supporting users, courses, enrollments, assignments, and grades
static_description: Five interconnected tables structured to support core platform features including user management, course catalog, enrollment tracking, assignment distribution, and grading systems.

resource_dependency.mobile_navigation_menu: Hamburger menu icon transforming into cross during active state

function: Responsive UI design with honeydew background and dark olive green components
static_description: Entire application styled using CSS custom properties setting base background to honeydew and primary interactive elements/components to dark olive green. Layout adapts fluidly across screen sizes.

interaction_and_states.description: Layout adjusts breakpoints smoothly transitioning between stacked mobile view, split tablet layout, and multi-column desktop presentation.
Toggles slide-in navigation sidebar replacing top navbar on smaller screens.

static_description: Root-level package.json script definition executing parallel installations in both frontend and backend directories ensuring synchronized dependency setup.

function: Package.json configuration with npm run dev for concurrent frontend and backend development servers
